str2: Instantly, immediately, on the spot. From para and chrema; at the thing itself, i.e. Instantly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
Praise. Apparently a prime word; properly, a story, but used in the sense of epainos; praise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
